Title: Balancing theory with practice: Studying the rebound effect
Abstract: The International Energy Agency (IEA) reveals that residential buildings are estimated to account for 74% of global building energy use, of which 30% is estimated to be used for space heating. The IEA also estimates that space heating demand in the global residential stock has grown by only 5% between 2002 and 2012, despite increases in total populations, households, incomes and expectations of thermal comfort. Energy policy directed at the residential stock has sought to manage and shift energy demand through changes in occupant practices, operations, and building fabric performance.
